ul.li: An AES MAC key with key usage PTR2AUTH is not supported in releases before Release 5.5.
Support for authenticated PAN changes only applies to ISO-4 to ISO-4 PIN-block format translations, and it is not supported in releases before Release 5.5.12.

Beginning with Release 5.5, when keyword PAN-CHG is specified in the rule array and required command (offset X'0395') is enabled in the active role, the AES MAC key identified by the authentication_key_identifier parameter must have key usage PTR2AUTH. This is the key to be used to verify the CMAC in the authentication data for ISO-4 to ISO-4 PAN change.

As of 5.4 and 6.2, this verb supports three-key TDES keys. As a key management service this includes triple-length TDES key encrypting keys (KEKs). For a list of supported triple-length TDES key types beginning with Release 5.4 and Release 6.2, see .
